briefTitle: Do Angiotensin Receptor Blockers Mitigate Progression to Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome With SARS-CoV-2 Infection
officialTitle: Randomized Open Label Study of Standard of Care Plus an Angiotensin II Receptor Blocker Compared to Standard of Care Alone to Minimize the Progression to Respiratory Failure in SARS-CoV-2 Infection

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Confirmed COVID-19 positive test result
* Mild to moderate respiratory symptoms of COVID-19.
* Systolic blood pressure â‰¥ 105 mmHg.
* Screen within 3 days of a positive COVID-19 test.
* Age â‰¥18 years old.
* Access to a phone in the hospital room or an electronic device that is capable of receiving phone or video calls.
* Able to read/write/speak English or Spanish fluently.
* Subjects must have the capacity to provide consent or an appropriate LAR to provide informed consent.
* Negative pregnancy test for women of childbearing potential and subject is randomized to the study arm.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Severe allergy to any ARB or ACE-inhibitor, including angioedema
* In the intensive care unit at screening.
* Home meds include any kind of ACE inhibitor or ARB
* Acute Kidney Injury (50% reduction in GFR from baseline at admission to any time during treatment in the study treatment arm)
* Hyperkalemia \>5.0 mmol/L at baseline or any time during treatment in the study treatment arm
* Creatinine Clearance \< 30 ml/min at baseline or any time during treatment in the study treatment arm

primary.description: Number of subjects requiring transfer into ICU for mechanical ventilation due to respiratory failure
primary.timeFrame: from date of patient admission to date of patient discharge or date of death, whichever came first, assessed up to 45 days

secondary.description: Number of subjects transferred from non-ICU bed to an ICU bed
secondary.timeFrame: from date of patient admission to date of patient discharge or date of death, whichever came first, assessed up to 45 days

secondary.description: Mean number of liters of oxygen consumed
secondary.timeFrame: from date of patient admission to date of patient discharge or date of death, whichever came first, assessed up to 45 days

other.description: Length of hospital stay from admission to discharge
other.timeFrame: from date of patient admission to date of patient discharge or date of death, whichever came first, assessed up to 45 days

other.description: Number of subjects who expired while hospitalized
other.timeFrame: from date of patient admission to date of patient discharge or date of death, whichever came first, assessed up to 45 days
